result.execSummary:
The defendant Dwight Larock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 2 days only if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 36 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any taverns, bars, liquor stores or similar establishments (Class B) that sell or provide alcohol for consumption.

The defendant must submit a DNA sample.

The defendant must undergo an anger management assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must take all medications as prescribed by his treating physian.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Huber allowed - no objection to the sentence being served in Shawano County as long as arrangements are made but it is the ultimate decision of the Sheriff(s).

supervisions.notes: Standard rules of supervision and any other rules of ES to be set by DOC.

Attorney Tristan Susan Breedlove in court who appears telephonically with leave of the Court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:40 AM. State - here for a review on the sentence credit that was filed by defense counsel. Court agrees. Breedlove makes statement, she is the appeal attorney, not sure if Court can proceed today without the defendant present, the petition for sentence ajustment was filed by the defendant prior to Attorney Breedlove being on the case. State would like time to review the paperwork further and set for another hearing. Court suggests setting it on 4/10/18. Breedlove doesn't want to go that far out, asking for a telephonic hearing sooner. Court will continue the matter and allow the parties to speak and if it is resolved thru an agreement, then the parties can contact JA Casteel to set the matter for a hearing. Parties are in agreement with that process.

Defendant Dwight Larock in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Defendant Dwight Larock in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 8:19 AM. State - here on SEHR. Court understands that the defendant has revoked himself on this matter. Larock agrees. State - has reviewed the revocation packet - makes final statement prior to recommendations - recommends 3.5 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 1 year of initial confinement followed by 2.5 years of ES - defendant has substantial credit. Court makes comment as to what the DOC has recommended (9 months). State is aware of their recommendation and disagrees with it especially due to all the credit he has coming. Court asks for the past criminal history of the defendant. State informs Court of the defendant's criminal history. Burns makes final argument prior to recommendations - does point out an inaccuracy in the revocation paperwork - states the defendant has 259 days jail credit - recommends 9 months in jail. State comes up with 201 days credit. Larock withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 3.5 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 1.5 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES, conditions of ES to be set by DOC and follow standard rules of supervision, 259 days credit (stipulated), turn any unpaid fines into civil judgments or as deemed appropriate by Forest County normal collecting procedures, eligible for programs, right to appeal, adjourned.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 20, 2017 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Dwight Larock in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Defendant Dwight Larock in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:14 PM. State - here for PLEAS. Burns - resolved - defendant signed the plea questionnaire back in March while he was incarcerated in Shawano County Jail. State - dismiss and read in count #2, amend count #1 to statute 961.41(3g)(am) as PTAC - joint recommendation of a withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: conditional jail - free to argue, $1000 fine plus costs and surcharges, AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns or similar establishments, 200 hours of community service, employment/school, no contact with Shawna Rachal, take all medications as prescribed by treating physician. Burns agrees except for the no contact provision for stated reasons. State willing to change the no contact provision to no contact with Shawna Rachal except for child custody issues. Burns makes additional statement in regards to that. State - willing to leave that condition up to P&P. Burns agrees as does Larock. Court has plea questionnaire, accepts G plea given on plea questionnaire, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. Court dismisses and reads in count #2. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation except for conditional jail time - argues for 120 days of conditional jail time. Burns makes final argument prior to sentencing - leaves the jail component up to the Court - argues for 2 days of jail credit. Larock makes statement, asks for leniency. Court sentences the defendant to the following: withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: 120 days in Forest County Jail - 2 days jail credit only if revoked - no objection to serving the sentence in Shawano County Court if arrangements have been mailed and it is up to the Sheriff(s) - huber allowed; $1000.00 fine plus costs and surcharges ($2733.00) - paid thru probation,  AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns, liquor stores or similar establishments that sell or provide alcohol for consumtpion, 200 hours of community service, maintain/obtain full time employment/school (36 hrs/week), take all medications as prescribed by treating physician, submit DNA sample, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.

Called 3:45 pm.  Defendant Dwight Larock in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Dwight Larock in custody.  Attorney Mary L.R. Burns appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Charles James Simono appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews status of case. Simono requests $3,000 cash bond w/No consumption of alcohol.  Defendant believes he is in custody for a revocation of his probation. Burns argues for lessor bond. Court vacates warrant; sets $2,500 cash bond w/conditions as previously ordered.  Defendant advises court that he has surgery that "they" want to schedule on January 25th.  Simono no objection to a furlough for surgical procedure. Burns agrees.  Court advises that when surgery is scheduled he will approve a furlough.  March 31, 2016 @ 10:00 am is next appearance.

Attorney Henry Reid Schultz in court.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:06 AM. State believes the defendant is incarerated in Menominee Tribal Jail. Schultz has filed a motion to withdraw as counsel and argues that motion, should be eligible for SPD and will make that referral if Court would like, matter is scheduled for JT in November. Court grants request for withdrawal of counsel and signs the order in Court.  Schedule for TSC on 10/12/15 at 8:30 and parties to contact JA in Shawano County. Defendant Dwight Larock in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State - here for motion filed by defense counsel. Court so orders, ID's listed in the motion are not allowed and State may bring independent sources if needed. Schultz - did sent copy of the disc to the Court and will get one fotr the file if neded. Court agrees. Court continues bond, set for FPT on 9/22/15 at 9:15 PM and JT on 11/4/15 and 11/5/15. Motions to be filed by mid-August.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 09:15 am.
